column1: 10 pts - You have clearly identified the production function as the one that could benefit the most from implementing scrum/sprint methodologies. Great job explaining the specific ways it could operate for this function and comparing it to kanban. Keep up the good work!

Rating: 10/10

Comment: Good job! Your description of scrum/sprint for the production function is well-explained, with just a bit of vagueness. Keep up the good work!
8 pts - Complete and clear description of poor fit. Great job explaining why kanban may not be the best fit for the production function at Mighty Jaxx. Keep up the good work!
10/10 - Great job identifying the distribution function as a suitable area for implementing kanban methodologies and providing specific ways it could operate. Keep up the good work!
12 pts - Very complete and clear description of how kanban could operate. Great job in providing specific details on how kanban can be implemented in the distribution function. Keep up the good work!

7 pts - Some vagueness or incompleteness in discussion of fit. 

Your response provided a good explanation of how scrum/sprint could work for the production function, but the discussion on why it is a poor fit for the distribution function was not as clear. Keep up the good work and try to provide more specific details in future responses.

5 pts - Selected bias is clearly relevant to this situation.

Great job identifying confirmation bias as a potential issue in this situation and providing suggestions to avoid it. Keep up the good work!

10 pts - Complete and correct definition

Great job defining confirmation bias and providing suggestions to avoid it. Keep up the good work!
12 pts - Complete and clear description of possible problem. Great job in addressing the potential impact of cognitive biases and providing suggestions to mitigate them. Keep up the good work!

10/10

Great job! You provided a clear and complete description of possible steps and actions for implementing agile methodologies in Mighty Jaxx's production and distribution functions. Keep up the good work!
